frameDefinitions: The words in this frame describe situations in which a Perpetrator forcibly seizes control over a Victim's Vehicle to gain some end.  '' 'French farmers have hijacked a lorry and destroyed its load of strawberries.'
An organic item, the Patient, has undergone the natural process of rotting  and decaying with a possible expression of the Degree to which the rotting has occurred.
An Item comes to be attached to a Goal, with a Connector forming a bond between the Handle of the Item and the Goal (or some part of it).
In this frame the Patient, an inorganic item, undergoes a chemical process which renders it less useful, desirable or stable. '' '
The Fastener is an artifact created to close a Container (e.g. coat, jar).

This frame covers a step in a criminal process in which a  Judge decides whether the Accused should be released on bail, and, if so, what the amount of the bail should be.  '' 'Thorsen, of Grimstad, Norway, was granted $100,000 bail until June 18.'
frameExamples: French farmers have <t>hijacked</t> a lorry and destroyed its load of strawberries.
According to plan, the front part of the hull quietly <t>attached</t> to the docking gear.
The door <t>seal</t> prevented air from getting in and the kids' screams from getting out.
Thorsen, of Grimstad, Norway, was granted $100,000 <t>bail</t> until June 18.
listRoleDefinitions: This is the person (or other agent) who forcibly seizes control over a vehicle to gain some end.
This is the means of transportation which gets under the control of the perpetrator. Example: The terrorists hijacked <fex name='Vehicle'>the plane</fex>.
This role describes the people that are suffering as a result of the <fen>Perpetrator</fen>'s action.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is the organic matter that has decayed.
<fen>Connector</fen> identifies the  instrument used to attach, usually in a <ment>with</ment>-PP.
<fen>Item</fen> identifies the entity that comes to be attached to the <fen>Goal</fen>.
<fen>Items</fen> identifies the plural items that are tied together, resulting in their mutual attachment.
<fen>Goal</fen> identifies the location to which the first <fen>Item</fen> is attached.
The time when the attaching event takes place.
The location where the attaching event takes place.
The <fen>Patient</fen> undergoes a change.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Patient</fen> corrodes.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Patient</fen> corrodes.
This role identifies the item that is closed with the <fen>Fastener</fen>.
The artifact created to close a <fen>Container</fen>.
This role identifies the active zone of the container where the <fen>Fastener</fen> is located.
At the time of bail setting, the <fen>Accused</fen> is held without bail/bond, released on his/her own recognizance, or required to give the Court  a specific amount of money for bail.
The <fen>Judge</fen>, as head of  the Court, determines the <fen>Accused</fen>'s bail.
<fen>Status</fen> idenitifies the decision made with regard to bail.  The possible statuses are 'without bail/bond', 'on one's own recognizance', or a specific amount of money required for bail.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the bail setting occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the bail setting occurs.
listRoleExamples: The rebels skyjacked a plane <fex>with 89 passangers</fex>.
The remoras attach to the whale <fex>with their strong jaws</fex>.
The remoras attach <fex>to the underside of the whale</fex>.
<fex>The bikes</fex> rusted from their former beauty.
On Friday night, many men will simply elect to remove their tie and unbutton their top <fex>shirt</fex> button.
Man, I have just bought the exact same belt <fex><t>buckle</t></fex> and it won't open.
We couldn't close the <fex>tent flap</fex> zipper and a lot of flies came in .
Judge Duncan fixed <fex>the doctor's</fex> bail at one million dollars.
<fex>Judge Duncan</fex> fixed the doctor's bail at one million dollars.
Judge Duncan fixed the doctor's bail <fex>at one million dollars</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Regional Water Quality Control Board
